entities: United Nations Political Office for Somalia (UNPOS)
Contact Group on Piracy off the Coast of Somalia (CGPCS)
reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports within six months on the protection of Somali natural resources and waters, and on alleged illegal fishing and illegal dumping, including of toxic substances, off the coast of Somalia; within two months on the modalities of specialized Somali courts to try suspected pirates
summary:
22. The Council urges States, UNODC, and regional organizations to increase prison capacity in Somalia, including constructing additional prisons, and requests UNODC to provide training and monitoring.

23. The Council requests the Transitional Federal Government (TFG) to elaborate and adopt a complete set of counter-piracy laws, and welcomes progress made in Puntland and Somaliland.

24. The Council emphasizes the need for effective coordination of anti-piracy efforts and requests the Secretary-General to strengthen the United Nations Presence in Somalia (UNPOS).

25. The Council supports regional States' development of anti-piracy courts or chambers and requests the Secretary-General to assist.

26. The Council decides to consider establishing specialized Somali courts to try suspected pirates, and requests the Secretary-General to report on modalities within two months.

27. The Council urges State and non-State actors to provide support for judicial and detention projects through the Trust Fund.

28. The Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
